programme.title: Mat 1: Men +100 kg Contest for Bronze Medal B | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This event took place on 02/08/2024 at the Champ-de-Mars Arena. Alisher Yusupov (UZB) get the Bronze Medal B, with a victory over Tatsuru Saito (JPN), Final score UZB 11:0 JPN.

programme.title: Mat 1: Men +100 kg Final | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This event took place on 02/08/2024 at the Champ-de-Mars Arena. Teddy Riner (FRA) claimed the Gold medal and Kim Minjong (KOR) took Silver. Final score FRA 10:0 KOR.

programme.title: Israeli duo working hard to achieve Olympic dream
programme.desc: Linoy Ashram and Raz Hershko are two of Israel's leading junior athletes seeking to join the nation's Olympic squad.

programme.title: Mixed Team Bronze Medal Match IND - USA | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Mixed Team Bronze Medal Match took place at Invalides, Paris, on 02/08/24. United States won the Bronze Medal with a victory over the India 6:2

programme.title: Coming of age: China after Beijing 2008 | Episode 1
programme.desc: The legacy of the 2008 Beijing Games lives on at the Qingdao Sports School, which drove China’s gold medal rush, and at the world’s largest football academy in Guangdong.

programme.title: Mixed Team Gold Medal Match KOR - GER | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Mixed Team Gold Medal Match took place at Invalides, Paris, on 02/08/24. The Republic of Korea won the Gold Medal with a victory over Germany, who won Silver, 6:0

programme.title: Shakti: India’s Super Women
programme.desc: The inspiring stories of four top Indian female athletes who have faced unmatched obstacles in order to triumph at the high levels. Shakti features wrestler Sakshi Malik, gymnast Dipa Karmakar, karateka Sandhya Shetty and archer Deepika Kumari. Watch Now”

programme.title: Men's Final | Cycling BMX Racing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Cycling BMX Racing Men's Finals took place on 02/08/2024 at Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines BMX Stadium.
Joris Daudet (FRA) won Gold, Sylvain Andre (FRA) won Silver and Romain Mahieu (FRA) won Bronze.

programme.title: From The Top Episode 2: Charlotte Worthington and The Vamps
programme.desc: Olympic BMX champion Charlotte Worthington meets one of her favourite bands, The Vamps. After attending their concert and hanging our backstage, she invites them for some action at the BMX park. Will they be up for the challenge?

programme.title: Kieran Reilly’s ride to the world stage | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Join Kieran Reilly on his quest for Olympic glory as he reflects on his journey from Gateshead to becoming BMX world champion. He navigates the challenges of training, family support, and personal growth, while striving to make his hometown proud. Follow his inspirational story as he prepares to represent his community at the next Olympic Games in Paris 2024.

programme.title: Viktoriia: Ukraine’s Gymnastics Hope
programme.desc: As the bombs dropped in her hometown of Kyiv and her father left home to fight in the war, Ukrainian rhythmic gymnast Viktoriia Onopriienko battled daily to make her dream – competing in Paris 2024 – come true. This documentary showcases her grit, resilience and determination in her inspiring journey to compete at the Olympic Games. Discover the indomitable spirit of this young athlete as she prepares to represent Ukraine on the world stage.

programme.title: Day Jobs | Episode 1
programme.desc: Olympic bronze medallist Chris Fogt is also an army captain while Ana Rente is bouncing between trampoline and her career as a doctor.

programme.title: The Olympic spirit : Greek gift, the ancient games
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 1 : The Olympic spirit : Greek gift, the ancient games.

programme.title: Women's Team QFs/SFs/Finals | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Quarter-Finals, Semi-Finals and Finals for Women's Team Archery took place on 28/07/2024 at Invalides, Paris. The Republic of Korea won Gold, France won Silver, and Turkey won Bronze.

programme.title: Shakti: India’s Super Women
programme.desc: The inspiring stories of four top Indian female athletes who have faced unmatched obstacles in order to triumph at the high levels. Shakti features wrestler Sakshi Malik, gymnast Dipa Karmakar, karateka Sandhya Shetty and archer Deepika Kumari. Watch Now”

programme.title: Men's Team QFs/SFs/Finals | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Quarter-Finals, Semi-Finals and Finals for Men's Team Archery took place on 29/07/2024 at Invalides, Paris. The Republic of Korea won Gold, The People's Republic of China won Silver, and Mexico won Bronze.

programme.title: The Tech Race | Episode 3
programme.desc: In this episode: hockey tracking systems, tennis gliding shoes, ski helmets for the partially blind, archery technology, and hi-speed cameras for training.

programme.title: Original Fuel (Film)
programme.desc: In the former Soviet Union, athletes representing young republics have forged their own path to DIY training and Olympic success.

programme.desc: This event took place on 27/07/2024 at the Chateauroux Shooting Range, Paris. CHN claimed the Gold, KOR the Silver and KAZ completed the podium.

programme.title: India’s Abhinav Bindra I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of India’s first-ever individual gold medallist, Abhinav Bindra, and how he is now helping others fulfil their dreams.

programme.title: Women's 10m Air Rifle Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10m Air Rifle Final took place at Chateauroux, France, on the 29/07/24. Hyojin Ban (KOR) won Gold with a total of 251.8. Yuting Huang (CHN) won Silver, and Audrey Gogniat (SUI) completed the podium.

programme.title: Meet the pistol shooter funding her passion with a career as an engineer
programme.desc: Canada’s Lynda Kiejko is making the most of her career as an engineer to follow in the footsteps of her three-time Olympian father.

programme.title: Men's Trap Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Trap Finals took place on 30/07/2024 at Chateauroux Shooting Centre. Nathan Hales (GBR) won Gold, Qi Ying (CHN) won Silver, and Jean Pierre Brol Cardenas (GUA) won Bronze.

programme.title: Teenage duo Suratwadi & Wiberg have Olympic and Paralympic Games in focus
programme.desc: Hard work and a willingness to learn keep weightlifter Phonnapha Suratwadi and wheelchair racer Ty Wiberg on course for the Games.

programme.desc: The Men's 50m Rifle 3 Position Final took place at Chateauroux, France, on the 01/08/24. Yukun Liu (CHN) won Gold with a total of 463.6 points, Serhiy Kulish (UKR) won Silver, and Swapnil Kusale (IND) won Bronze.
